alert.note: Alert for Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 12:13AM EST until February 20 at 11:12PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill, Menifee and Powell. In south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Lee, Magoffin, Morgan, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Liberty, Irvine, Mount Vernon, Jackson, Beattyville, McKee, Campton, Booneville, Boone, Simpson, Henry, Lewis, Fincastle, Ravenna, Mount Olive, Proctor, White Ash, Belle Point, Corgleton and Maloney.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
